posts.title: Building Scalable SaaS: Lessons from Media Intelligence
posts.author: Luis Bonilla
posts.excerpt: Key architectural decisions and lessons learned while building a media intelligence platform that processes thousands of URLs per hour.
posts.content:
Building a scalable SaaS platform requires careful consideration of architecture, data flow, and infrastructure. In this article, I share the key lessons learned while building a media intelligence platform capable of processing over 5,000 URLs per hour...

## Architecture Decisions

### Microservices vs Monolith

We started with a modular monolith and gradually extracted services as bottlenecks emerged...

### Database Design

PostgreSQL proved to be an excellent choice for our needs, providing both relational integrity and JSON support...

## Scaling Strategies

### Horizontal Scaling

Implementing a queue-based architecture with Redis enabled us to scale processing workers independently...

### Caching Layer

Strategic caching reduced database load by 70%...

## Monitoring and Observability

Prometheus and Grafana provided crucial insights into system performance...

## Conclusion

Building scalable systems is an iterative process that requires continuous monitoring and refinement.
